# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:, :ym] = map(x -> string(x[1]) * string(lpad(x[2], 2, '0')), DateTime.(df.dt))
    return df
end
```

This function uses a comprehension to create a new column `ym` by extracting the year and month from each element in the `dt` column using `DateTime` type. It then concatenates these values into a string representation of the year-month in the format "yyyymm" before storing it back into the DataFrame as a new column `ym`.
